title: Understanding React
content: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It allows developers to create reusable UI components.
author: John Doe

title: Getting Started with Zustand
content: Zustand is a small, fast, and scalable state management library for React apps. It is minimal and easy to integrate.
author: Jane Smith

title: Exploring TypeScript
content: TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript that adds optional static typing to the language.
author: Alice Johnson

title: Introduction to Next.js
content: Next.js is a React framework that enables server-side rendering and static site generation.
author: Bob Brown

title: Building Responsive Layouts
content: Learn how to create responsive layouts using modern CSS techniques like Flexbox and Grid.
author: Charlie Davis
